meanings.definition: To eat something, especially noisily or greedily.
meanings.sent1: The rabbit was munching on a carrot.
meanings.sent2: I enjoy munching on popcorn while watching movies.
meanings.sent3: The chipmunk was munching away happily in the garden.
meanings.sent4: The waves were munching on the sandy shore.
meanings.sent5: The toddler was munching on a cookie, leaving crumbs everywhere.

meanings.definition: The act of eating something, especially with a crunching sound.
meanings.sent1: The loud munching of the chips could be heard across the room.
meanings.sent2: I couldn't concentrate with all the munching coming from the next table.
meanings.sent3: The munching of the leaves by the caterpillar sounded like a tiny orchestra.
meanings.sent4: The munching of the gears in the old clock made a rhythmic ticking noise.
meanings.sent5: The munching of the snow under our boots echoed in the quiet forest.
